clinical_study.brief_title: Distal Radius Fracture: Clinical Outcome After Conservative Treatment in the Elder Patient
clinical_study.official_title: Distal Radius Fracture: Clinical Outcome After Conservative Treatment in the Elder Patient

brief_summary.textblock: This study is performed to evaluate the outcome of conservative treatment after distal radius fractures in patients of 65 years or older at the time of the injury, primarily with respect to the prognostic value of the Adolfsson-score for the functional demands of the patient on his hand.

primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Adolfsson-Score quantifies the patient`s utility of the Hand; 8-point scale ranging from 1 = no activity done using hand/arm to 8 = professional activity with high physical stress for the arm. Lower scores reflect fewer effort in using arm/Hand; higher scores reflect higher strain in using arm/hand

secondary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Suhm Score quantifies the independency of a patient in his daily life. 4-point scale ranging from 1 = living at home, independent to 4 = living in nursing home, dependency. Lower scores reflect high independency of a patient in his daily life; higher scores reflect higher dependency of a patient in his daily life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quick Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Quick DASH score is a 11-item, self-report questionnaire that measures physical function and symptoms in people with musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb. The QuickDASH is scored in two components: the disability/symptom section (11 items, scored 1-5) and the optional high performance sport/Music or work modules (4 items, scored 1-5). A higher score indicates greater disability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline

intervention.intervention_name: Questionnaires to assess Patient reported Outcomes
intervention.description: Adolfsson-Score questionnaire quantifies the patient`s utility of the hand. Suhm Score questionnaire quantifies the independency of a patient in his daily life.
wrist function assessed by the range of motion (ROM) for both the affected and the unaffected side.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a distal radius fracture who had undergone a conservative treatment at the University Hospital in Basel

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Distal radius fracture with conservative treatment
- Treated in 2014 or 2015
- X-ray of injury
- Informed consent by the patient to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- No X-ray
- No signed informed consent
- Demented patients
